page.title: 13FOREST OF DEAN GARDEN CENTRE
page.content: THE PRESENT OWNERS OPENED PYGMY PINETUM GARDEN CENTRE IN 1967. IT EMPLOYS 4 PEOPLE. IT COVERS AN AREA OF ONE ACRE AND HAS A STREAM RUNNING THROUGH IT. THE FIRST YEAR THE CENTRE WAS OPENED THEY HAD 80% TOURISTS & 20% LOCALS AS CUSTOMERS: THIS YEAR IT IS 80% LOCALS & 20% TOURISTS. ABOUT 80,000 PEOPLE VISIT EACH YEAR. THEY GROW THE PLANTS IN CONTAINERS SO BUYERS CAN PLANT THEM ALL YEAR ROUND. THE ACER IS THE DEAREST PLANT AT Â£15 AND THE CHEAPEST COSTS 30-40 PENCE. THE HEATHER IS THE BEST SELLING PLANT. A GREENHOUSE COST Â£3,500. THEY HAVE SOME TROUBLE WITH VANDALISM BUT VERY LITTLE STEALING. THEY WOULD LIKE MORE PARKING SPACE & INTEND PLACING CHAIRS AND TABLES FOR THE ELDERLY.
